text: Oregon Brewfest was odd this year, a ton of sour and fruit beers. and most of the things I tried were just not good. the international stuff was great tho, some killer japanese, german and norwegian stuff. But what the hell everyone else…. There seems to be this huge surge of Gose suddenly, and a lot of berliner wiesse
yeah, the sours makes sense when i think about overall trends.
Betts have been trending for like 2 years now
as have session beers
leads nicely into lightly alcoholed, sem-sour beers ike Gose and Berliner's
makes sense. But I still dont want them
LOL

feels like they were playing this larger crowd adoption game. More non beer drinks are more likely to drink a sour or fruit beer. But it is a beer festival, not a cider fest, or the fruit beer fest. It was a completely different offering than usual
and a sour beer on a hot day, doesnt really sound refreshing or a good time
i hear ya all around.
Hmm interesting

related - i’m not a fan of the ‘session’ beer thing.  1) beers have been over hopped and over proof’d for too long.  when the response is ‘regular beer - 5% again’ i think it makes the whole thing silly.  but on a subjective taste note - i’ve never had a session ale or session ipa that didn’t have a diet soda/metallic after taste

totally fair and true, this session marketing thing suddenly is making a big splash. They usually are lack luster. or alright… session ipa is just a joke, they usually lack much of any taste at all. Would hardly call them a pale and certainly not an ipa
Yea, I had a session IPA this weekend that hurt my stomach
and it was 4.3%
So hard to drink

I still like some overproofed beer when done right, the alcohol adds flavor, but it needs to be done right. a lot of them are just booze for booze sake. But when its part of the flavor like a barleywine it is nice, adding in this caramel and toffee complimentary to the malt
Beers usued to ‘naturally' be 4.3%!
<@U0XJFPSRL>: which one?

<@U0XJFPSRL|elisecramer> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/elisecramer/F1X3S90FL/158f9120fc752e41260d676e418d06904bb04a4f_fort-george-overdub-session-ipa_4x6.jpg|158f9120fc752e41260d676e418d06904bb04a4f_fort-george-overdub-session-ipa_4x6.jpg> and commented: Fort George

the session one is pretty meh, pretty much that whole line is a lot of meh, the fest one at christmas is ok. the new hef they did lacks any of the flavor a hef should have. following the american blahhhh hef style widmer leads the charge on… a real hef has amazing body and flavor. just have some hofbrau hef, changes your world on the understanding of a real hef
have not had that one yet
thanks - will certainly avoid this one.
<@U0EL0GLEL>: are you saying you dont like fort george?  i think they’re honestly a top 10 fav of mine
no, i like ft george they usually do great stuff
im talking about full sail line of “session” stubby bottles
I’m a sucker for that session lager on a hot day, ice cold, with spicy food
It’s been my go to cheap beer this summer
Sure I dont think its bad, its just not that exciting ha, I still like some cheap ass beers, some high life and fishing ha
it’s funny, Full sail session beers are fine.  they’re liek the OG.  I’ll drink em cuz they’re cheap and the bottle is rad
im just annoyed by the whole american hef, its just not that good, and the german original is incredible
and their session ipa is not that great, its not bad, but its not that great. its more of a pale then an ipa

And I dont want any lemon in my beer, if you didnt make it right in the first place… why do i need to add lemon? I was at this bar once and they lady asked if i wanted lemon, I said no, she says, oh thats NFL style “NO FUCKING LEMON"
then you drink the german hef and think why would you ever put lemon in this, its amazing and perfect
but cheers to full sail and their innovation and putting out different stuff in that line. I think thats cool
Yea, I’m such a sucker for the stubby bottle

I like any cool bottle. Especially when making my own stuff. I think its all part of the experience. You make this awesome drink, and now you want to put it into something cool. Getting a sweet bottle adds to that. I’m always looking for non standard bottles for things
